intro: Mesembryanthemum asperulum, commonly known as the roughleaf ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its unique adaptations to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss and store moisture. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in spring and summer. Mesembryanthemum asperulum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and attractive appearance.
